bibl.title: Abduction at the Threshing Floor: P. Duk. inv. 714-716.
bibl.note: The papyri. Group of petitions by Petosiris, a hawk-feeder at the hawk shrine in Oxyrhyncha, acquired in 1979 (from a cartonnage). Arsinoite, 140/39-137/6; ca. 140/39. - Phanias and the circumstances of the petitions. - Apollônios ὁ πρὸς τῆι στρατηγίαι (τεταγμένος). - Sarapiôn archisômatophylax. [For a description of the techniques applied in the decipherment of Inv. 716, see: John F. OATES, Richard J. WEINBERG, Joshua D. SOSIN and Paul B. JOHNSON, Reading Invisible Ink: Digital Imaging of P. Duk. Inv. 716, ibidem, pp. 127-130, 4 figg.].
bibl.seg: SOSIN Joshua D., Abduction at the Threshing Floor: P. Duk. inv. 714-716.

The papyri. Group of petitions by Petosiris, a hawk-feeder at the hawk shrine in Oxyrhyncha, acquired in 1979 (from a cartonnage). Arsinoite, 140/39-137/6; ca. 140/39. - Phanias and the circumstances of the petitions. - Apollônios ὁ πρὸς τῆι στρατηγίαι (τεταγμένος). - Sarapiôn archisômatophylax. [For a description of the techniques applied in the decipherment of Inv. 716, see: John F. OATES, Richard J. WEINBERG, Joshua D. SOSIN and Paul B. JOHNSON, Reading Invisible Ink: Digital Imaging of P. Duk. Inv. 716, ibidem, pp. 127-130, 4 figg.].
